tweets.text: Our teams doing a great job putting up temporary barrier in #Weybridge https://t.co/bkHdTHakvL

Why is the @EnvAgency supporting the building of a structure which will put further pressure on wild fish populations? One associates dams as vanity projects for authoritarian regimes; they are not a sensible approach to river or flood management. More imagination needed. https://t.co/toswOXXwFA

Appropriately on #WorldWetlandsDay I'm drafting the first case study of estuarine #rewilding to appear on @RewildingB network pages - @WWTSteart. Astonishing carbon sequestration figs and biodiversity benefits emerging from this @EnvAgency flood risk management project. https://t.co/qX0Rd7eLez
@LHG_27 @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @Wychavon @CllrAHardman We're waiting to hear - we'll post when there's news

A groundwater flood alert has been issued for east Kent.

We are working extremely closely with the @EnvAgencySE @Kent_cc and @SouthernWater to tackle any problems that might come our way.

Full update: https://t.co/WmmGJa33p2 https://t.co/To6JzCRZyA

tweets.text: @KenGoodwinITV Gravity is King!
@WorcsTravel @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @Wychavon @CllrAHardman Any news on Eckington bridge as to whether it’ll be back open this evening? 😊

Surface water #flooding is possible in parts of northern and central England due to rain falling on saturated ground.

Stay safe and don’t walk or drive through flood water. 

For guidance on #SurfaceWaterFlooding in your area, contact your local authority. 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/GUyF4cRfLT

Pleased to have witnessed this part of Salford transformed into Kersal Wetlands which doubles as @EnvAgencyNW flood basin. Nice way to celebrate #WorldWetlandsDay2021 @salford_mayor @SalfordCouncil @EmmaHowardBoyd @johncurtinEA @tomstannard @MikeMcCusker15 https://t.co/RbOaXieVjP

urls.title: Angling Trust says no to damning the River Severn - Angling Trust
urls.description: The Angling Trust has put its weight behind calls for the Environment Agency and Shropshire Council to drop its proposal to install a dam on the River Severn near Shrewsbury.  Local angling clubs, including the Prince Albert Angling Society, and the campaign group, Save Our Severn, have raised concerns about the impact a dam would have on the environment […]

tweets.text:
The Angling Trust has put its weight behind calls for the Environment Agency and Shropshire Council to drop its proposal to install a dam on the River Severn near Shrewsbury.  

Read more: https://t.co/LlzkCssPoK

Our officers are supporting the Environment Agency with their work on the installation of the temporary flood defence barrier at Walton Lane. @EnvAgencySE and @MariaHerlihyEA https://t.co/I2iPP1Sn1S #SurreyPrepared #floodaware https://t.co/io5RvSkQfS

Hushed up in the 90s, #Capperpass since admitted their actions of dumping tonnes of contaminated over the area. The long lasting affects have been found through an @EnvAgency research project in the area, which found toxins & heavy metals. Why are they churning up the soil? https://t.co/ANFGzlYwHj

I don't understand how my town can be already underwater and yet the flood alert is Yellow: Flooding is possible
@EnvAgency

urls.title: EA boss backtracks on sewage pollution blunder
urls.description: Environment Agency chief executive Sir James Bevan has been forced to issue a clarification after he incorrectly told a House of Commons committee that the regulator did not allow water firms to discharge raw sewage into chalk streams.

tweets.text: I'm sure there are many excellent scientists, fieldworkers and specialists at @EnvAgency but this is a classic example of the type of senior leadership they have to endure https://t.co/HnoCCIaTa3

urls.title: The Economics of Biodiversity: The Dasgupta Review – Reactions
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We’d like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. Where we have identified any third party copyright information you will need to obtain permission from the copyright holders concerned. This publication is available at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/final-report-the-economics-of-

tweets.text:
.@EmmaHowardBoyd welcomes the Dasgupta Review which calls to change how we measure economic success and invest more in nature recovery.

Read about how nature and economics go hand in hand here: https://t.co/bIqFgizzMa

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/ZVChGBFYgV
@nestdivert Swallow and House Martins are protected species. Certainly not a pest This is wildlife crime @StaffsPoliceRWC Please investigate this @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @guardianeco

urls.title: Youth Voice Summit - Rethinking Water
urls.description: A chance for you to input your opinions and experiences on future water management and how you would like to engage in giving your opinion in the decisions made by the Environment Agency in the future.

tweets.text:
On 16 March we and @EnvAgency are holding a special online event for young people! 

Join this interactive session to share your thoughts on future water management, and how the Environment Agency can engage with young people.

Find out more and sign up 👇 https://t.co/Gmx3uHGWJI

urls.title: Evenlode Catchment Partnership | Wild Oxfordshire
urls.description: “The tender Evenlode that makes Her meadows hush to hear the sound Of waters mingling in the brakes, And binds my heart to English ground. A lovely river, all alone, She lingers in the hills and holds A hundred little towns of stone, Forgotten in the western wolds.” — Hilaire Bello c The Evenlode Catchment Partnership, hosted by Wild Oxfordshire, has a vision for an Evenlode with improved water quality, enhanced flood management, enriched biodiversity, with greater community engagement with rivers, at

tweets.text: @campbellar @EnvAgency We have a contingency plan in place until completion of repair works. Start date is dependent on approval of sand lizard licence, anticipated in Feb. urls.title: Flooding

It's LGBT+ History Month! We're proud to support our LGBT+ staff.

Our @LGBTHM staff network will be running events on this year's theme of Mind, Body & Spirit to help staff remain connected, even when we can't celebrate in person like we did here in 2017.

#LGBTHM21 | #TeamEA https://t.co/OBRaadM0Nf
